quote.author: Jane Austen
quote.text: “The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid.”

quote.author: Steve Martin
quote.text: “A day without sunshine is like, you know, night.”

quote.author: Garrison Keillor
quote.text: “Anyone who thinks sitting in church can make you a Christian must also think that sitting in a garage can make you a car.”

quote.author: Jim Henson
quote.text: “Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye.”

quote.author: Charles M. Schulz
quote.text: “All you need is love. But a little chocolate now and then doesn't hurt.”

quote.author: Suzanne Collins
quote.text: “Remember, we're madly in love, so it's all right to kiss me anytime you feel like it.”

quote.author: Charles Bukowski
quote.text: “Some people never go crazy. What truly horrible lives they must lead.”

quote.author: Terry Pratchett
quote.text: “The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it.”

quote.author: Dr. Seuss
quote.text: “Think left and think right and think low and think high. Oh, the thinks you can think up if only you try!”

quote.author: George Carlin
quote.text: “The reason I talk to myself is because I’m the only one whose answers I accept.”

quote.author: W.C. Fields
quote.text: “I am free of all prejudice. I hate everyone equally. ”

quote.author: Jane Austen
quote.text: “A lady's imagination is very rapid; it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment.”
